question_sentence: Which royal residence hosted Emmanuel Macron's state visit to the UK?
evidence: Emmanuel Macron and his wife Brigitte were received by the King and Queen Camilla at Windsor Castle rather than Buckingham Palace, which is being renovated. The French presidential couple were honoured with a state banquet at the castle on Tuesday evening, with the royal family, Mick Jagger and Elton John among around 160 VIP guests.

question_sentence: What is the name of the new political party announced by tech billionaire Elon Musk?
evidence: Elon Musk announced he is forming a new political party, vowing to "crack the uniparty system". The move was in response to a Republican budget bill signed by Donald Trump, which Musk claims would "bankrupt the country".

question_sentence: The remains of a 3,500-year-old city have been found in which country?
evidence: The ruins of Peñico, in the north of modern-day Peru, date back around 3,500 years to when it was built by the Caral, the oldest known civilisation in the Americas. At a press conference announcing the discovery, archaeologist Marco Machacuay said 18 structures, including temples and residential buildings, have been unearthed so far.

question_sentence: An imposter recently used AI to mimic which US official?
evidence: An imposter used artificial intelligence to mimic Secretary of State Marco Rubio, contacting high-ranking officials through voice and text messages. The unknown "actor" left voicemails on the Signal app and targeted foreign ministers, a governor and a member of Congress.

question_sentence: Which Formula 1 team announced the shock departure of its boss?
evidence: After 20 years as team principal, Christian Horner has been replaced by Laurent Mekies. In a statement, Red Bull said Horner, 51, would "forever remain an important part of our team history". It had been a "difficult 2025 season", said Motor Sport, with the Formula 1 team's star driver Max Verstappen dropping out of contention for the world championship.

question_sentence: The newly opened Legoland resort in Shanghai was built using how many Lego bricks?
evidence: China's first Legoland resort, now open in Shanghai, is being described as the largest in the world. Built with 85 million Lego bricks, the park features replicas of famous landmarks from around the globe, as well as a traditional Chinese water town, all crafted entirely from Lego.

question_sentence: A former senior judge says courts in England and Wales could clear their trial backlog by scrapping what?
evidence: Brian Leveson said scrapping juries for some criminal offences would help avoid a "total collapse" of the justice system. The right to be tried by a jury of one's peers is a foundational element of US and English common law, but jury trials are far from universal – many democracies use them rarely or not at all.

question_sentence: Which luxury fashion brand broke records after one of its handbags sold for $10 million at an auction?
evidence: The first Birkin bag ever made, once owned by British actress and singer Jane Birkin, became the most valuable handbag ever sold at auction, fetching $10.1 million. Birkin regularly used the bag between 1985 and 1994.

question_sentence: Why did rock band The Velvet Sundown go viral this week?
choices: Their show ended in a riot
They set a new streaming record
evidence: Despite releasing two albums and racking up around a million streams a month on Spotify, internet sleuths worked out that The Velvet Sundown are entirely AI-generated, from their laid-back rock tunes to portraits of the band's "members". Their Spotify profile has since been amended to describe the group as a "synthetic music project guided by human creative direction".

question_sentence: Which extinct animal is Colossal Biosciences working to bring back, with help from filmmaker Peter Jackson?
evidence: Colossal Biosciences is partnering with director Peter Jackson to resurrect a bird resembling the giant moa, which disappeared from New Zealand 600 years ago. The company previously made headlines in April for creating wolves with the genetic properties of the extinct dire wolf.

question_sentence: Which country became the first to formally recognize the Taliban government of Afghanistan?
evidence: Russia announced this week that it had accepted an ambassador from the Islamist group.

question_sentence: President Donald Trump has named an interim NASA administrator. Which of the following people did he select?
evidence: Trump said Duffy “will be a fantastic leader of the ever more important Space Agency, even if only for a short period of time.”

question_sentence: Several right-wing media figures were angered by a Justice Department memo debunking conspiracy theories surrounding which of the following people?
evidence: The memo said there was no evidence that disgraced financier and accused sex trafficker Jeffrey Epstein kept a “client list” or that he was murdered.

question_sentence: Why did the Environmental Protection Agency suspend roughly 140 employees this week?
choices: They signed a public letter critical of the agency
They purchased lottery tickets with taxpayer dollars
They refused to relocate to a new office
evidence: The letter’s signatories said they were concerned about the treatment of federal employees and the Trump administration’s regulations on climate and public health.

question_sentence: Billionaire Elon Musk said he’s launching a new political party. What is its name?
evidence: Musk indicated he wants the “America Party” to be fiscally conservative but has offered few details about what its platform will be.

question_sentence: The US has seen a record 1,277 confirmed cases of measles so far this year due to which of the following reasons?
choices: There’s a new strain of measles
evidence: The vast majority of this year’s cases have been in unvaccinated people.

question_sentence: Which of the following was the first named storm of the 2025 Atlantic hurricane season to hit the US?
evidence: Chantal triggered life-threatening flash floods after making landfall in the mid-Atlantic region before deteriorating into a tropical depression.

question_sentence: Where is Pope Leo XIV spending his summer vacation?
evidence: The pope will spend two weeks at Castel Gandolfo, the hilltop town about an hour’s drive from Rome.

question_sentence: A genetic engineering startup recently added which creature to its list of extinct animals it plans to resurrect?
evidence: Colossal Biosciences plans to bring back the South Island giant moa, a huge, flightless bird that once inhabited New Zealand and disappeared around 600 years ago.

question_sentence: What music legend recently gave his final performance?
evidence: Ozzy Osbourne reunited with the original members of Black Sabbath for his farewell performance earlier this month.
